The next spring visit.
The first visit of this year was an opportunity to stay in a house that had already been renovated.
Impressively, this was the one we'd visited by torchlight only six months previously.
We arranged to meet with Manos in a cafe near the office in the port.
After a daytime flight, we found ourselves in the cafe above the new marina.
Enjoying a very welcome cooling drink.
He arrived late and flustered and welcomed us with a flurry of sorrys and bristly double cheek kiss each.
Oh, it's been hectic in the office today.
Less hectic, I quietly and unkindly thought to myself now that you're here with us and not still there.
We had some more drinks and after Manos had relaxed and briefly discussed some of his plans for our house,
it was agreed we would follow him in our hire car up to the renovated house in the hills.
It was just as well that we did.
We'd previously been driven there in the dark and I doubt that I would have found it again in the rabbit warren of streets and alleyways.
Eventually we drove up at the side of a large storm drain
and after parking the cars crossed over into the track.

set in a newly pointed stone wall with a newly plastered wall over it.
This is the house, come in said Manos unlocking the door.

there were lots of modern lights, a fitted kitchen and interesting objects and furniture.
